headline: Gutfeld: Be nicer. It will drive your enemies nuts
subHeadline: Be appreciate and take the high road.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS MATTHEWS, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: Good evening, I'm Chris Matthews, and steaming, swamp-like Washington which has just been drenched with its heaviest July rainfall and three quarters of a second is wet in this town and steaming.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: Somebody's boxers are sticking. Enough. You want to drive your enemies nuts? Have a lot more fun than they are.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Remember I said, we're going to be a little bit wild and we'd have a lot of fun. And they'll say, "He's not acting presidential." And I'd say, "Well, it's a lot easier to act presidential than to do what I do." Anybody can act presidential. Ladies and gentlemen of the state of Florida, thank you very much for being here. You are tremendous people. And I will leave now because I am boring you to death. Thank you.  I can be more presidential than any President in history, except for possibly Abe Lincoln with the big hat. I don't know about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Abe Lincoln was the big hat. Could you imagine Abe and Trump in a debate? Check out Mr. Big Hat over here. Mr. Big Hat, what's he hiding under there, Mr. Big Hat. Another smaller hat? All right, so what's all this fun causing? The people not having fun are getting sick of you, of Trump and of themselves. For example, since Trump got elected there's been a jump in patients suffering from what scientists call Trump Anxiety Disorder, or TAD. TAD. Isn't everything bad named Tad? I mean, do you know a good Tad? By the way that was a tadpole. It's been a long way for that joke. What a long way. Wasted a lot of time for that one. All right, according to CDC News, a symptom of TAD is a feeling as if the world is ending. I wonder who is spreading that.

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump and his erratic behavior could be leading the United States towards World War III.

utterances.speaker: JOY BEHAR, CO-HOST, THE VIEW
utterances.sentences: We're talking about annihilating millions of people.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If this border wall happens it will be an unprecedented environmental catastrophe.

utterances.speaker: JOHN AVLON, POLITICAL ANALYST, CNN
utterances.sentences: We can't begin to normalize this. This is dangerous. This is childish. This is un-presidential.

utterances.speaker: TREVOR NOAH, COMEDY CENTRAL
utterances.sentences: This is it, the end of the presidential race and it feels like the end of the world.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Of course. Now, it's easy to mock the suffering but I am not. When you see what is coming out of the quivering Cronkite, you can't blame gentler souls for falling ill. This whole industry is selling us fear and they are calling it facts. That's another symptom, but the fear spreads faster than a cold sore from Bill Clinton. Fear sells. Fear sells. So now the media has replaced climate change with Trump change as their apocalyptic wish fulfillment.  Everything bad in this world is Trump's fault. Pick any bad news and you can trace it back to him. Even stuff that happened before he was born. World War I, Trump's fault. World War II, Trump's fault. Synchronized swimming, Trump's fault. The problem, things just keep getting better. We're doing good with North Korea and the Middle East. GDP is going up and unemployment keeps dropping. Consumer confidence is higher than Obama's mom jeans. We have peace and prosperity, yet the other networks see doomsday. Every day is doomsday. And there is the problem. If every day is doomsday, how do you know what the real doomsday is? What we need is a super duper doomsday.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What if everything you knew about doomsday was wrong? Get ready for super duper doomsday. Where it's really, really the end of the world for sure no lies, going to happen, we swear, so buckle up you're going to die and so is everyone else. It all starts when President Trump severely slices a tee shot while golfing at Mar-a-Lago. The ball careens off into space, striking a nearby asteroid which then crashes into the moon, splitting into thousand pieces. Moon fragments smash earth TV satellites causing them to only broadcast "The View" 24 hours a day. This causes the world's IQ to plummet dramatically, except for Chris Cuomo, he actually becomes smarter.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS CUOMO, HOST, CNN
utterances.sentences: I missed you, my friends. What do you say? Let's get after it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Humanity is seen chasing each other in stores with alligators causing Dana Perino to swear like a sailor. Turtles quickly become the dominant species and start eating everything causing them to grow in an exponential rate. The UN responds by making another movie about Abba that sucks so bad, it causes the sun to hurl itself into Jupiter causing all of our blenders to make nothing but the worst kind of virgin daiquiris. Meanwhile, the giant turtles have began to devour entire cities causing Don Lemon to speak in reverse English.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.sentences: Don't believe what you see with your own ears.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Within hours only, a few hundred humans remain with the final survivors mount a last stand by electing Adam Levine as their leader. He tries to make peace by singing ...

utterances.speaker: ADAM LEVINE, AMERICAN ARTIST
utterances.sentences: "She will be loved."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Upon hearing this, the earth itself implodes destroying everything ever created except a doomsday bunker full of my pillows. Thus completing super duper doomsday. And it was all Trump's fault.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's the best. The best ever. That was the best. All right. So the ugly truth as the media, Hollywood, academia deplore Trump, they wouldn't exist without him. Seriously, if Trump were to disappear, what would they be doing?  All right, so if you think these people are sick from Trump anxiety, just imagine their Trump withdrawal. Talk about a doomsday. Fact is, you can't go back after Donald. He's introduced something into politics that we haven't seen in quite a while. It's energy.  Media anxiety is not from the apocalypse, it's from trying to keep up. It's the first time in eight years they had to. They see these weird damp circles underneath their arms and they go, "What the hell is that, doctor?" It's sweat. Something you did not see when you were reporting about Obama. So what about us? Things are going pretty good which means, it's time for ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Tough love with Greg Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Welcome to tough love with Greg Gutfeld. Look, I'm not crazy about CNN or Jim Acosta. He's like tube of Brill cream that learned to pout. But the jeering at the rallies, it's really not a good luck, and I mean it. It's like when I drink too much I think that I look great, but in reality I should not be in the park wearing nothing but Crocs. They never believe me when I say I'm walking a dog.  So, when I see all the yelling at Acosta, I do get the anger, the jeering is borne from a cynicism about a press that under Obama have their spines removed to make it easier to bend over. And now, it is clean. It's clean. Now that Trump is here, you see the media working overtime and it's the contrast that bugs you and me. But when you are winning and you are, you don't need to scream. In fact, I think that's piling on. So my suggestion, stop. And instead, do what my mom always said, "Kill them with kindness." Or was it a machete. I could never tell with mom. It was either kindness or a machete with her.  There was no middle ground. But let's stick with kindness. You've got to be appreciate and take the high road and be nicer. You will look better and it will drive the media even more nuts and they will be so confused, they will probably think it is the end of the world, again.  Yes, another great monologue. Let's welcome tonight's guests. That is not a truck backing up, we are just bleeping her filthy language. My co-host on "The Five" and anchor of the "Daily Briefing," or bleeping, Dana Perino. Besides the TV dinner, she is my favorite Swanson. the original vampire slayer, the legendary Buffy herself, actress Kristy Swanson. All right, one of the best intros ever. Her keyboard only has one letter, which is why she is always depressing. "National Review" reporter, Kat Timpf. That's too good. And his baseball cap gets altitude sickness, former WWE superstar and my massive sidekick, Tyrus.  All right, Dana, I cannot believe I have to say this, but try to keep it clean.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Yes, thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We have some children here in the audience.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I see him. Yes, he was here for your monologue.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know. What do you make of, I guess, the idea -- this conflict between the media and the administration and who should take the high road? Should we take the high road? You know what I remember, what Jedediah said on "The Five" which kind of struck me. We have -- like, when I lecture people, we have the luxury of a show, so we can talk about all of the stuff that the audience ...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The media driving us crazy like we have an outlet for it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But the people at the rallies don't, so when they see CNN, they go, "You," because that's their outlet, so am I wrong?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't think that that's wrong. But I think that your advice is actually good. The tough love, right? Because I do think, not to get so technical on the polls, he is bleeding women. The approval ratings are plummeting for him with women. And it's not about the economy, they know the economy is good. It's not about Russia, they don't really care about Russia. It's his temperament. And so, I think that that is just not helping. It is not necessary. I think that the reporters, they don't even actually need to be in the room.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They could be outside. And you're just going to see it on -- you have one TV camera, like Jim Acosta doesn't need to be in the room, it's like he's becoming part of the story and it's not necessary.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But if they are outside, the story will be reporters kept outside. It is Trump's fault. Kristy, welcome to the show. So much good news in the economy, is that what is driving the media kind of nuts. It's that they cannot figure out what to say about him?

utterances.speaker: KRISTY SWANSON, AMERICAN ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: They just want to put him down with any chance that they have. I mean, they just want to destroy him, like the video we just saw. It's terrible. It is bad. And they need to stop. They are aging themselves.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Are they aging themselves?

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They look like they are getting gray, or white.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.sentences: Look at -- I mean, they just look so angry and awful and they need to lighten up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.sentences: ... changes ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I've noticed Anderson Cooper's hair is totally white. And Stelter, bald. I mean, these are -- they're obviously having an effect. Kat, give me some of your deep analysis on what is going on in the current political climate. How you feel? Are you angry? Are you nervous? Perturbed?

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, NATIONAL REVIEW
utterances.sentences: I am angry, and nervous and perturbed. But it is usually about other stuff like it's about when I get food later, what if I ordered the wrong thing and I don't like it and I wish I got another thing? Or what if when I'm walking down the street, someone sneezes on me and then I get a cold again? Or what if I hang out with somebody who seems to be healthy, but they're actually harboring the cold virus and I wound up getting sick from them because they are still contagious?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm seeing a trend here.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: So, there's a lot of things, definitely to worry about. I don't worry so much. I mean, the amount of anxiety that some people have about President Trump, only one person should have that anxiety about the President, and that is the President. Like, it could be a little -- he could be a little nervous about making important decisions. But I think actually, I get a little more nervous about my food order than he does. He seems like he kind of just is pretty chill about being President.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I think, you know what, I talked about this before. To him, it's just another kind of a big project and he talks about it like it's a job. He will share the details of this job to you that no other President would, like the stuff he has to deal with, Tyrus. But I'm glad you made it. You almost didn't make it tonight. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, FORMER WWW WRESTLER: Yes, I made it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Stuck on a plane. He was circling for four hours above the studio.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes. It was great. If I could piggyback on Dana Perino for a second, shut up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think that would be called ...

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Her point -- she's got a great core base, she could do it. I mean, been there for a long time. Take three steps. Three steps where we're good at. But her point is spot on. The Acosta thing. I, because of my background in wrestling, and President Trump has a long historic history with wrestling and (inaudible) man 101. And Acosta likes the chanting. He likes that stuff because you're exactly right, why is he not on the outside?   Reporters used to do that, but you cannot get those reactions and those ratings. He even -- so they can see him, stands up higher than the crowd and stands over them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: "Hey, I'm here. I'm here." And they get going and they start doing the wrestling chants, "You suck" or whatever it is and he eats it up and he acts out and strut, but he literally, if he got down and walked away to do his report, it would be over. But he's doing it for the attention, for the reason that he despises President Trump who seeks attention. They do the same thing. It's because they are involved in a war between the media and specifically most of the things like CNN has become the front runner in this one-on-one dogfight with the President. And they are willing to go anywhere to go after him, but they want to hold themselves in a higher court, but they are the same thing, and Trump, he is the baby face right now. So, the crowds are going to cheer him. They're going to boo you, so just -- you're the bad guys.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is a mismatch because he is a street -- this is who he is.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: They can't win this fight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: They don't even know how to be a good heel, like Acosta would have told them, like, "Hey, shut up, lady." Or how did you get here? You can't afford it. Like start heckling the crowd back, Acosta, like, get ...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a great idea.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Be a bad guy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Great idea. They should really do that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: They should heckle them. I am doing a report on you, sir and your extramaritals. Like, be a bad guy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Also they have no sense of humor. Like you were saying earlier, if you cannot beat them, join them. And laugh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Just laugh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Maybe it would be better.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I just hope that -- I hope that like -- I just would like -- people looking like a mob does not appeal to me in any shape or form. Because I am really a good person at heart. No, I'm not, I am a terrible person. Thank you. Coming up, Hillary Clinton teams up with Steven Spielberg. Is she the next Indiana Jones or more like, Wisconsin failure? Am I right? Unemployment is so low even Hillary found a new job. Good for her. The petulant pant suit is teaming up with Steven Spielberg, whoever that is, to produce a documentary on the woman suffrage movement. The struggle women endured to earn the right to vote. So that a hundred years later than they could elect Donald Trump. Oops, sorry, I gave away the ending. I gave away the ending on that one. All right, so Hillary is producing television now which is a powerful gig. TV is a very persuasive medium. I think this is great. The more stuff she produces, the more fun I can have with her. I wonder what her next project is going to be?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Coming this fall, Hillary Clinton presents, I hate everyone on this planet, especially Greg Gutfeld. A 35-part series.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I cannot wait for that. Kat, what you make of this? Does it upset you? It should.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, I just don't how you get a gig like that being Hillary Clinton. Because she does not really strike me as being a very creative person. I do not think she has ever finger painted, like even as a child, she was probably like, "No, I am not doing that." She was able to hire another kid to do the finger painting for her. That is just how I see it. I mean, she had to hire basically a team of writers for her Twitter to try to make jokes on Twitter. So, if you cannot even do your own tweets, how are you going to make you're a movie? I think that she is really good at one thing, which is just like sitting there and looking terrifying.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kristy, obviously, Hollywood, you do a lot of movies. Does she deserve this opportunity? What you make of this?

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.sentences: No. I mean, come on. A producer? Like an executive producer?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You do not need a lot for that, do you?

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.sentences: You do, I mean, no. She is going to sit like in a director's chair or hang out at craft service eating donuts and collect the check.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.sentences: That's all it is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And Bill is thinking, "I will do the casting couch."

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: By the way, Dana, serious point, shouldn't they be -- if she is a real feminist should they do a documentary on Harvey Weinstein? Because that would be a truly feminist work, but she cannot because she overlooked his behavior because he was giving so much money to the party and to her in order to get elected. So probably the worst example of a feminist is her, maybe.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, you said it very well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I do wonder if they will start off with the women who really started of the movement to get the right to vote were from Wyoming, which is where I am from. Typically conservative women there, but I don't know if they'll get a lot of credit. I also think she is not going to have to do anything. Just like I don't think that Barack Obama and Michelle Obama are going to have to do anything for the millions they are getting from Netflix.  This is just a name added to it. When James Patterson wrote his latest book, he added Bill Clinton to it, right? It was a collaboration. James Patterson didn't need Bill Clinton to help him sell books. Spielberg doesn't need help from Hillary Clinton to help him sell movies. This is basically, it is like if you fail, then you get picked up by Hollywood if you are a liberal. And I am not bitter about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, you should be. I am.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I have not failed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, you have not failed, but when I fail, no one is there. I have no safety net. By the way, maybe this is just a weird thing that I dreamt. But wasn't the suffrage movement created in part for -- to create the prohibition? So women would vote, isn't that right? To get rid of alcohol?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Maybe, but part of it was property rights, and also in Wyoming, you didn't have that many women -- you didn't have that high of a population so they wanted women to be able to vote to increase their vote total.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I did not know that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But property rights were a big deal, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tyrus, what are your thoughts on Hillary's next move?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: We all should be really afraid. I've been telling you all with not messing with her. To leave her alone. Stop messing with her. If there is a scary old lady on your block and there's always that one kid who always wants to go pick that peach from her tree and we're like, "Don't do it. Don't to it." And the one -- and then one day, he goes and she catches him. She is about to catch this man. She is not going away. Like, she is going to use this vehicle because she is going to try to get in touch with the people. Spielberg is the vehicle. He is the name. He has a big fan base. Anything he touches and it's a about women, so in her mind, this is going to help her get her reelection bid going. This is a path for her to get re-in-touch with her base. She's going to start putting women forward and this movie is about women's right to vote because we need to stick together to stop the evil Trump. I'm telling you, it's all going to come right back to Donald Trump and a Darth Vader suit at the end of the movie. You know what I'm saying, like I guarantee. It will be like this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We should just call it "Jaws 7."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, I am just envisioning Hillary's house now has like seven or eight Frisbees on the roof because none of the kids go over to get it back.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Exactly. Everyone who grew up in a neighborhood knows the lady I am talking about. This is the lady times ten.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Like the beast in the sandlot?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I didn't see that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: No, because that was a dog and he was sweet when he got hurt. No, this -- if she got hurt, she would just be one arm and still crawling at you like Terminator. You stay away from the mean lady in the ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, coming up, do trigger warnings do more harm than good? Harvard says yes. Who is Harvard? I've never heard of him.

utterances.speaker: ANITA VOGEL, CORRESPONDENT, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Anita Vogel. Venezuela's embattled the President surviving tonight what some are calling an assassination attempt. Drones loaded with explosives detonated during a speech find Nicolas Maduro. Maduro is safe and unharmed, but seven soldiers were injured. The President is blaming the right-wing opposition for the attack. He is also pointing the finger at Columbia's President. Some are disputing the government's version of events saying it was a gas tank explosion inside an apartment. President Trump is reportedly concerned that his eldest son may have violated the law. "The Washington Post" reports that the President has told confidants that Donald Trump, Junior may have unintentionally crossed a line. Special counsel, Robert Mueller is investigating Trump, Junior for arranging a meeting in 2016 between a Russian lawyer and campaign officials. I am Anita Vogel, now, let's take you back to "The Greg Gutfeld Show." For all your headlines, log on to fox ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And now, a story about trigger warnings which calls for a trigger warning. Old people get the reference. A new study from Harvard, a school I am told finds that trigger warnings may do more harm than good. Researchers had two groups read scenes from books depicting graphic violence. One group got a trigger warning, one didn't. What they found, trigger warnings do in fact increase people's emotional vulnerability to trauma. Meaning, if you're someone who believes words can hurt you, a trigger warning makes it worse. That is crazy. Think of it this way, someone who might have been able to handle something shocking without a trigger warning, would actually be less able to handle it because of the warning. So trigger warnings are actually causing pain, not preventing it. This is nuts. Which is why I've come up with a great new product. One that counters trigger warnings with blunt world advice from someone you know very well.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Sometimes I want direction, but I also want advice from my favorite national security strategist. Why can't I have both?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, now you can, thanks to Gorka Positioning System. It's the world's first geo-locator to come with a dose of no-nonsense advice from Sebastian Gorka.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Time to destination one hour. There are no shortcuts in life and if you believe otherwise, then you are a drooling dimwitted twit brain washed by the liberal academic media complex. I pity you and your sad deprived children. Turn right at the next intersection.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Nice.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And Gorka Positioning System is always there with a helpful reminder.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This traffic is terrible.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There's a tollbooth ahead so I hope you have the money after the loathsome relentless infantile Democrat that screwed you on taxes. It's a shame, you make and make and all they do is take and take. They would rather expand government than your wealth. Also, there is a passing lane ahead.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Thanks Gorka Positioning System.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Plus Gorka Positioning System will keep you out of dangerous areas on road trips.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Uh, where are we?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: In 500 feet turn right. Because the only way in which to fight political correctness and ideological prejudice is to turn right. Then turn left to avoid global jihad.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Spring break, here we come.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No car, no problem. You can download the Gorka Positioning System right to your smart phone.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Construction ahead, so stay to the left, which shall be easy for you, your filthy communist garbage, and I can see so get a haircut. You look like a tramp.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So get Gorka Positioning System today. You'll never get lost or disappoint your parents again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Gorka was supposed to be on the show tonight. He could have used the GPS. But he did not make it, so he's not here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: His failure to plan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you know, we got you, Dana. Which is ...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Consolation price, I know, but I can do the accent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do the accent, please?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I can do the Gorka accent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But if they are outside, the story will be reporters kept outside. It is Trump's fault. Kristy, welcome to the show. So much good news in the economy, is that what is driving the media kind of nuts. It's that they cannot figure out what to say about him?

utterances.speaker: KRISTY SWANSON, AMERICAN ACTRESS
utterances.utterance: They just want to put him down with any chance that they have. I mean, they just want to destroy him, like the video we just saw. It's terrible. It is bad. And they need to stop. They are aging themselves.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are they aging themselves?

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They look like they are getting gray, or white.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: Look at -- I mean, they just look so angry and awful and they need to lighten up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: ... changes ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I've noticed Anderson Cooper's hair is totally white. And Stelter, bald. I mean, these are -- they're obviously having an effect. Kat, give me some of your deep analysis on what is going on in the current political climate. How you feel? Are you angry? Are you nervous? Perturbed?

utterances.speaker: KAT TIMPF, NATIONAL REVIEW
utterances.utterance: I am angry, and nervous and perturbed. But it is usually about other stuff like it's about when I get food later, what if I ordered the wrong thing and I don't like it and I wish I got another thing? Or what if when I'm walking down the street, someone sneezes on me and then I get a cold again? Or what if I hang out with somebody who seems to be healthy, but they're actually harboring the cold virus and I wound up getting sick from them because they are still contagious?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm seeing a trend here.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: So, there's a lot of things, definitely to worry about. I don't worry so much. I mean, the amount of anxiety that some people have about President Trump, only one person should have that anxiety about the President, and that is the President. Like, it could be a little -- he could be a little nervous about making important decisions. But I think actually, I get a little more nervous about my food order than he does. He seems like he kind of just is pretty chill about being President.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I think, you know what, I talked about this before. To him, it's just another kind of a big project and he talks about it like it's a job. He will share the details of this job to you that no other President would, like the stuff he has to deal with, Tyrus. But I'm glad you made it. You almost didn't make it tonight. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, FORMER WWW WRESTLER: Yes, I made it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Stuck on a plane. He was circling for four hours above the studio.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes. It was great. If I could piggyback on Dana Perino for a second, shut up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think that would be called ...

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Her point -- she's got a great core base, she could do it. I mean, been there for a long time. Take three steps. Three steps where we're good at. But her point is spot on. The Acosta thing. I, because of my background in wrestling, and President Trump has a long historic history with wrestling and (inaudible) man 101. And Acosta likes the chanting. He likes that stuff because you're exactly right, why is he not on the outside? Reporters used to do that, but you cannot get those reactions and those ratings. He even -- so they can see him, stands up higher than the crowd and stands over them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: "Hey, I'm here. I'm here." And they get going and they start doing the wrestling chants, "You suck" or whatever it is and he eats it up and he acts out and strut, but he literally, if he got down and walked away to do his report, it would be over. But he's doing it for the attention, for the reason that he despises President Trump who seeks attention. They do the same thing. It's because they are involved in a war between the media and specifically most of the things like CNN has become the front runner in this one-on-one dogfight with the President. And they are willing to go anywhere to go after him, but they want to hold themselves in a higher court, but they are the same thing, and Trump, he is the baby face right now. So, the crowds are going to cheer him. They're going to boo you, so just -- you're the bad guys.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it is a mismatch because he is a street -- this is who he is.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: They can't win this fight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: They don't even know how to be a good heel, like Acosta would have told them, like, "Hey, shut up, lady." Or how did you get here? You can't afford it. Like start heckling the crowd back, Acosta, like, get ...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a great idea.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Be a bad guy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Great idea. They should really do that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: They should heckle them. I am doing a report on you, sir and your extramaritals. Like, be a bad guy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Also they have no sense of humor. Like you were saying earlier, if you cannot beat them, join them. And laugh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Just laugh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Maybe it would be better.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I just hope that -- I hope that like -- I just would like -- people looking like a mob does not appeal to me in any shape or form. Because I am really a good person at heart. No, I'm not, I am a terrible person. Thank you. Coming up, Hillary Clinton teams up with Steven Spielberg. Is she the next Indiana Jones or more like, Wisconsin failure? Am I right? Unemployment is so low even Hillary found a new job. Good for her. The petulant pant suit is teaming up with Steven Spielberg, whoever that is, to produce a documentary on the woman suffrage movement. The struggle women endured to earn the right to vote. So that a hundred years later than they could elect Donald Trump. Oops, sorry, I gave away the ending. I gave away the ending on that one. All right, so Hillary is producing television now which is a powerful gig. TV is a very persuasive medium. I think this is great. The more stuff she produces, the more fun I can have with her. I wonder what her next project is going to be?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Coming this fall, Hillary Clinton presents, I hate everyone on this planet, especially Greg Gutfeld. A 35-part series.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I cannot wait for that. Kat, what you make of this? Does it upset you? It should.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, I just don't how you get a gig like that being Hillary Clinton. Because she does not really strike me as being a very creative person. I do not think she has ever finger painted, like even as a child, she was probably like, "No, I am not doing that." She was able to hire another kid to do the finger painting for her. That is just how I see it. I mean, she had to hire basically a team of writers for her Twitter to try to make jokes on Twitter. So, if you cannot even do your own tweets, how are you going to make you're a movie? I think that she is really good at one thing, which is just like sitting there and looking terrifying.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kristy, obviously, Hollywood, you do a lot of movies. Does she deserve this opportunity? What you make of this?

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: No. I mean, come on. A producer? Like an executive producer?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You do not need a lot for that, do you?

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: You do, I mean, no. She is going to sit like in a director's chair or hang out at craft service eating donuts and collect the check.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: That's all it is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And Bill is thinking, "I will do the casting couch."

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, Dana, serious point, shouldn't they be -- if she is a real feminist should they do a documentary on Harvey Weinstein? Because that would be a truly feminist work, but she cannot because she overlooked his behavior because he was giving so much money to the party and to her in order to get elected. So probably the worst example of a feminist is her, maybe.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, you said it very well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I do wonder if they will start off with the women who really started of the movement to get the right to vote were from Wyoming, which is where I am from. Typically conservative women there, but I don't know if they'll get a lot of credit. I also think she is not going to have to do anything. Just like I don't think that Barack Obama and Michelle Obama are going to have to do anything for the millions they are getting from Netflix. This is just a name added to it. When James Patterson wrote his latest book, he added Bill Clinton to it, right? It was a collaboration. James Patterson didn't need Bill Clinton to help him sell books. Spielberg doesn't need help from Hillary Clinton to help him sell movies. This is basically, it is like if you fail, then you get picked up by Hollywood if you are a liberal. And I am not bitter about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, you should be. I am.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I have not failed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, you have not failed, but when I fail, no one is there. I have no safety net. By the way, maybe this is just a weird thing that I dreamt. But wasn't the suffrage movement created in part for -- to create the prohibition? So women would vote, isn't that right? To get rid of alcohol?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Maybe, but part of it was property rights, and also in Wyoming, you didn't have that many women -- you didn't have that high of a population so they wanted women to be able to vote to increase their vote total.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I did not know that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But property rights were a big deal, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tyrus, what are your thoughts on Hillary's next move?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: We all should be really afraid. I've been telling you all with not messing with her. To leave her alone. Stop messing with her. If there is a scary old lady on your block and there's always that one kid who always wants to go pick that peach from her tree and we're like, "Don't do it. Don't to it." And the one -- and then one day, he goes and she catches him. She is about to catch this man. She is not going away. Like, she is going to use this vehicle because she is going to try to get in touch with the people. Spielberg is the vehicle. He is the name. He has a big fan base. Anything he touches and it's a about women, so in her mind, this is going to help her get her reelection bid going. This is a path for her to get re-in-touch with her base. She's going to start putting women forward and this movie is about women's right to vote because we need to stick together to stop the evil Trump. I'm telling you, it's all going to come right back to Donald Trump and a Darth Vader suit at the end of the movie. You know what I'm saying, like I guarantee. It will be like this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We should just call it "Jaws 7."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, I am just envisioning Hillary's house now has like seven or eight Frisbees on the roof because none of the kids go over to get it back.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Exactly. Everyone who grew up in a neighborhood knows the lady I am talking about. This is the lady times ten.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Like the beast in the sandlot?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I didn't see that.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: No, because that was a dog and he was sweet when he got hurt. No, this -- if she got hurt, she would just be one arm and still crawling at you like Terminator. You stay away from the mean lady in the ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, coming up, do trigger warnings do more harm than good? Harvard says yes. Who is Harvard? I've never heard of him.

utterances.speaker: ANITA VOGEL, CORRESPONDENT, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Anita Vogel. Venezuela's embattled the President surviving tonight what some are calling an assassination attempt. Drones loaded with explosives detonated during a speech find Nicolas Maduro. Maduro is safe and unharmed, but seven soldiers were injured. The President is blaming the right-wing opposition for the attack. He is also pointing the finger at Columbia's President. Some are disputing the government's version of events saying it was a gas tank explosion inside an apartment. President Trump is reportedly concerned that his eldest son may have violated the law. "The Washington Post" reports that the President has told confidants that Donald Trump, Junior may have unintentionally crossed a line. Special counsel, Robert Mueller is investigating Trump, Junior for arranging a meeting in 2016 between a Russian lawyer and campaign officials. I am Anita Vogel, now, let's take you back to "The Greg Gutfeld Show." For all your headlines, log on to fox ...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And now, a story about trigger warnings which calls for a trigger warning. Old people get the reference. A new study from Harvard, a school I am told finds that trigger warnings may do more harm than good. Researchers had two groups read scenes from books depicting graphic violence. One group got a trigger warning, one didn't. What they found, trigger warnings do in fact increase people's emotional vulnerability to trauma. Meaning, if you're someone who believes words can hurt you, a trigger warning makes it worse. That is crazy. Think of it this way, someone who might have been able to handle something shocking without a trigger warning, would actually be less able to handle it because of the warning. So trigger warnings are actually causing pain, not preventing it. This is nuts. Which is why I've come up with a great new product. One that counters trigger warnings with blunt world advice from someone you know very well.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Sometimes I want direction, but I also want advice from my favorite national security strategist. Why can't I have both?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Well, now you can, thanks to Gorka Positioning System. It's the world's first geo-locator to come with a dose of no-nonsense advice from Sebastian Gorka.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Time to destination one hour. There are no shortcuts in life and if you believe otherwise, then you are a drooling dimwitted twit brain washed by the liberal academic media complex. I pity you and your sad deprived children. Turn right at the next intersection.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: And Gorka Positioning System is always there with a helpful reminder.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This traffic is terrible.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: There's a tollbooth ahead so I hope you have the money after the loathsome relentless infantile Democrat that screwed you on taxes. It's a shame, you make and make and all they do is take and take. They would rather expand government than your wealth. Also, there is a passing lane ahead.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Thanks Gorka Positioning System.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Plus Gorka Positioning System will keep you out of dangerous areas on road trips.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Uh, where are we?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: In 500 feet turn right. Because the only way in which to fight political correctness and ideological prejudice is to turn right. Then turn left to avoid global jihad.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Spring break, here we come.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: No car, no problem. You can download the Gorka Positioning System right to your smart phone.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Construction ahead, so stay to the left, which shall be easy for you, your filthy communist garbage, and I can see so get a haircut. You look like a tramp.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: So get Gorka Positioning System today. You'll never get lost or disappoint your parents again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Gorka was supposed to be on the show tonight. He could have used the GPS. But he did not make it, so he's not here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: His failure to plan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you know, we got you, Dana. Which is ...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Consolation price, I know, but I can do the accent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do the accent, please?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I can do the Gorka accent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Very good. Very good. But in the real world, Dana, you aren't going to get a trigger warning.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, I was thinking about this, okay, so you know what happened to me earlier this week on "The Five." I didn't have a trigger warning about the alligator going into the convenience store. Had I known that the alligator was going to be terrorizing people in the convenience store, I might have prepared myself and not embarrassed the network by saying a bad word on live television.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, if you didn't fall, I don't know if you know about this, but on "The Five," Dana said something awful on the show which embarrassed all of her co-hosts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And we had to bleep it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But it was because of an alligator and if I had known that the alligator was going to do that, I might not have caused the problem.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tyrus, do you think trigger warnings -- I mean, they are like spoilers, isn't it better to find out things on your own?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I'm going to be real honest with you guys. My definition of trigger warnings is a lot different than you guys. I do a lot of prepping for this show and when I was like, trigger warning, and I remember, I was going to my car, we assumed -- I thought that was the same thing. So, you mean like a preemptive verbal cue that something verbally offensive is about to come?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You really need that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Apparently a lot of students feel that way.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Like "Jaws" music every time you make a decision.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's exactly what it is and you can choose to leave. If you hear the "Jaws" music, it's like, "Uh, you know what, I can't ..."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So like if I'm reading a book, "Once upon a time," no, thank you, okay, I got it. Cool.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kristy, I think the moral is, if you do well on certain matters, it actually makes it worse. It is like if you told a kid like a doctor comes in and says, "We're going to give you a flu shot. Just to let you know, it's a giant needle, and it is going to pierce your skin." I mean, a doctor comes in, my doctor, when he does certain types of exams talks to me while he is doing it, so I'm not paying attention, and then all of a sudden, I'll go, "Whoa," and I go, "What just happened?"

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's so much better.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's so much better. You get shocked by a finger.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, the sneak attack.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Wasn't that a great question that he just asked you? Isn't that a great question.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: I like it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are you saying that wasn't a question?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It was not a question at all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay, maybe it was a statement wrapped am a question.

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: I liked it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, but what are your thoughts in general?

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: I think it is ridiculous -- the trigger -- like to warn people. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: What? I learned something new today and I love trigger warnings. Can I get a trigger warning when you go on a date? Susceptible to stalking, we will call you constantly, won't leave you alone, we'll scare off all your friends, like that would be ...

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I would never have any dates.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat, last word.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I just think it makes perfect sense, just like the shopping or like anything else. If you say to someone, "Hey, this might emotionally traumatize you," then read it. How is that supposed to calm you down? That would be like if I came to you before every show and said, "Don't screw it up, Greg because if you screw it up, you're going to be real upset." I do not think that that would make you have a better show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it wouldn't, it wouldn't, but yet you still do it.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, I still kind of just said it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you did. It's funny, you know, a lot of people do that at Fox.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They really do. You walk away, "Don't screw it up." That really helps. Won't name names. Okay, still to come, a new government program that punishes you for your social behavior. Is this awesome, scary, or both? Your life will be grave if you misbehave. China, the country, not the fine dinnerware has rolled out a social credit system to spy on the behavior of its massive population. The reason, this from a government document, keeping trust is glorious and breaking trust is disgraceful. Lou Dobbs once said the same to me in a sauna. I never forgot it. Now, a social credit score is like your financial credit score, except it is way worse. Things like bad driving, smoking in a non-smoking area or posting fake news online can affect your social score. And people with low scores can be prevented from traveling. They can lose internet speed, miss out on school, jobs, and my world famous ambrosia salad recipe. It's true. It's amazing. The system is optional, but the Chinese government plans to make scores mandatory and public by 2020. Yes, in the words of Dana Perino -- holy [bleep]. That is pretty [bleep] scary.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mean, obviously.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, obviously. I'm going to go to you first, Tyrus, to let Dana calm down a bit. I kind of like this idea.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You like this idea?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Am I fascist?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: This dude like -- could you imagine if they put your social -- your internet history and all of that stuff that is on this, it would pop about you, you'd really want all those unicorns and naked party stuff you look at? This is a horrible idea for men.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Those are bodysuits, Tyrus. They're not naked.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: This is a horrible idea for men and my brothers in China, man, damn. Because everything you do, I mean because -- I can only speak for men, straight men. We are kind of decrepit, naughty little dudes and we look at a lot of stuff we shouldn't because we are just curious about the world and we can't express ourselves because we're trapped in this box of not being weird. So I really would not want to be like walking my son to school or my daughter to school -- I would not be able to take my daughter to school ever because there's like -- if you walk by, like, "Oh my god, he does all that stuff," like your rating would come out. Like his credit score is 600, but his personality score is a two, and his adult content is negative 75. I wouldn't want any of that stuff. That's terrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have a credit rating and a pervert trading.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes. Like, and it's like, you don't -- you know, I'm just curious. It doesn't mean that I am really looking at that stuff, I would be -- no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana, you love this topic. We've been talking about for months. Why do you love it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think it is the most evil way to try to control people. It is the system that is meant to depress any creativity and freedom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And swearing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And swearing, yes, like, screw that. Let me give you an example. They have a system there where, let's say you jaywalk. You ever jaywalk in New York City?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay, because it's easier to get across the street, you take your life into your own hands, whatever. They will take -- they have pictures of everybody at all times. You jaywalk. They take your picture, they match it to your credit score, but that's not just a credit score. They will say, "Dana Perino jaywalk today, also she owes the credit company X amount of dollars," and being in debt in China is a very embarrassing thing. And they basically try to control your entire life. They are making a huge mistake. I think the country has changed under President Xi in a very terrible way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Interesting.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So I do feel strongly about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She does. Kristy, how do you feel about it?

utterances.speaker: SWANSON
utterances.utterance: I feel the same way that Dana does. It is a big eye-opener to just really be appreciative of where we live and what we have and the freedoms that we have. I mean, it's scary.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
